thread.title: InventHelp Client's Device Allows For Easy Luring of Deer (DHM-116)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Client's Device Allows For Easy Luring of Deer (DHM-116) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Client's Device Allows For Easy Luring of Deer (DHM-116)
text:
Pittsburgh-based InventHelp is attempting to submit this idea, CUSTER'S LAST STAND, to companies in the hopes of a good faith review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 02, 2015
Tired of using duct tape to secure a can of peanut butter to a forked tree branch in order to lure deer, an inventor from Thomasville, N.C., decided that a better way was needed.
CUSTER'S LAST STAND serves as a better way to lure deer to a hunting site. It eliminates the need for makeshift holders, which saves time and effort. As a result, it promotes a more enjoyable hunting experience.
The original design was submitted to the Durham office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-DHM-116, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
